params.name: service_path
params.description: The domain name of the API remote host.

params.name: port
params.description: The port on which to connect to the remote host.

params.name: channel
params.description: A Channel object through which to make calls.

params.name: chan_creds
params.description: A ChannelCredentials for the setting up the RPC client.

params.name: client_config
params.description:
A Hash for call options for each method. See
Google::Gax#construct_settings for the structure of
this data. Falls back to the default config if not specified
or the specified config is missing data points.

params.name: timeout
params.description: The default timeout, in seconds, for calls made through this client.

params.name: app_name
params.description: The codename of the calling service.

params.name: app_version
params.description: The version of the calling service.

methods.name: delete_log
title: Google
Cloud
Logging
V2
LoggingServiceV2Client#delete_log
methods.description: Deletes all the log entries in a log. The log reappears if it receives new entries.

params.name: log_name
params.description:
Required. The resource name of the log to delete:

"projects/[PROJECT_ID]/logs/[LOG_ID]"
"organizations/[ORGANIZATION_ID]/logs/[LOG_ID]"

+[LOG_ID]+ must be URL-encoded. For example, +”projects/my-project-id/logs/syslog”+, +”organizations/1234567890/logs/cloudresourcemanager.googleapis.com%2Factivity”+. For more information about log names, see LogEntry.

params.name: options
params.description:
Overrides the default settings for this call, e.g, timeout,
retries, etc.

methods.name: write_log_entries
title: Google
Cloud
Logging
V2
LoggingServiceV2Client#write_log_entries
methods.description: Writes log entries to Stackdriver Logging. All log entries are written by this method.

examples.code:
require "google/cloud/logging/v2/logging_service_v2_client"

LoggingServiceV2Client = Google::Cloud::Logging::V2::LoggingServiceV2Client

logging_service_v2_client = LoggingServiceV2Client.new
entries = []
response = logging_service_v2_client.write_log_entries(entries)

params.name: log_name
params.description:
Optional. A default log resource name that is assigned to all log entries in +entries+ that do not specify a value for +log_name+:

"projects/[PROJECT_ID]/logs/[LOG_ID]"
"organizations/[ORGANIZATION_ID]/logs/[LOG_ID]"

+[LOG_ID]+ must be URL-encoded. For example, +”projects/my-project-id/logs/syslog”+ or +”organizations/1234567890/logs/cloudresourcemanager.googleapis.com%2Factivity”+. For more information about log names, see LogEntry.

params.name: resource
params.description:
Optional. A default monitored resource object that is assigned to all log entries in +entries+ that do not specify a value for +resource+. Example:

{ "type": "gce_instance",
  "labels": {
    "zone": "us-central1-a", "instance_id": "00000000000000000000" }}

See LogEntry.

params.name: labels
params.description:
Optional. Default labels that are added to the +labels+ field of all log
entries in +entries+. If a log entry already has a label with the same key
as a label in this parameter, then the log entry’s label is not changed.
See LogEntry.

params.name: entries
params.description:
Required. The log entries to write. Values supplied for the fields +log_name+, +resource+, and +labels+ in this +entries.write+ request are added to those log entries that do not provide their own values for the fields.

To improve throughput and to avoid exceeding the quota[https://cloud.google.com/logging/quota-policy] for calls to +entries.write+, you should write multiple log entries at once rather than calling this method for each individual log entry.

params.name: partial_success
params.description:
Optional. Whether valid entries should be written even if some other
entries fail due to INVALID_ARGUMENT or PERMISSION_DENIED errors. If any
entry is not written, the response status will be the error associated
with one of the failed entries and include error details in the form of
WriteLogEntriesPartialErrors.

params.name: options
params.description:
Overrides the default settings for this call, e.g, timeout,
retries, etc.

methods.name: list_log_entries
title: Google
Cloud
Logging
V2
LoggingServiceV2Client#list_log_entries
methods.description: Lists log entries. Use this method to retrieve log entries from Cloud Logging. For ways to export log entries, see Exporting[https://cloud.google.com/logging/docs/export].

examples.code:
require "google/cloud/logging/v2/logging_service_v2_client"

LoggingServiceV2Client = Google::Cloud::Logging::V2::LoggingServiceV2Client

logging_service_v2_client = LoggingServiceV2Client.new
resource_names = []

# Iterate over all results.
logging_service_v2_client.list_log_entries(resource_names).each do |element|
  # Process element.
end

# Or iterate over results one page at a time.
logging_service_v2_client.list_log_entries(resource_names).each_page do |page|
  # Process each page at a time.
  page.each do |element|
    # Process element.
  end
end

params.name: project_ids
params.description:
Deprecated. One or more project identifiers or project numbers from which
to retrieve log entries.  Example: +”my-project-1A”+. If
present, these project identifiers are converted to resource format and
added to the list of resources in +resourceNames+. Callers should use
+resourceNames+ rather than this parameter.

params.name: resource_names
params.description:
Required. One or more cloud resources from which to retrieve log entries:

"projects/[PROJECT_ID]"
"organizations/[ORGANIZATION_ID]"

Projects listed in the +project_ids+ field are added to this list.

params.name: filter
params.description:
Optional. A filter that chooses which log entries to return.  See Advanced[https://cloud.google.com/logging/docs/view/advanced_filters].  Only log entries that
match the filter are returned.  An empty filter matches all log entries.
The maximum length of the filter is 20000 characters.

params.name: order_by
params.description:
Optional. How the results should be sorted.  Presently, the only permitted
values are +”timestamp asc”+ (default) and +”timestamp desc”+. The first
option returns entries in order of increasing values of
+LogEntry.timestamp+ (oldest first), and the second option returns entries
in order of decreasing timestamps (newest first).  Entries with equal
timestamps are returned in order of +LogEntry.insertId+.

params.name: page_size
params.description:
The maximum number of resources contained in the underlying API
response. If page streaming is performed per-resource, this
parameter does not affect the return value. If page streaming is
performed per-page, this determines the maximum number of
resources in a page.

params.name: options
params.description:
Overrides the default settings for this call, e.g, timeout,
retries, etc.

returns.description:
An enumerable of Google::Logging::V2::LogEntry instances.
See Google::Gax::PagedEnumerable documentation for other
operations such as per-page iteration or access to the response
object.

  # Process element.

    # Process element.

params.name: page_size
params.description:
The maximum number of resources contained in the underlying API
response. If page streaming is performed per-resource, this
parameter does not affect the return value. If page streaming is
performed per-page, this determines the maximum number of
resources in a page.

params.name: options

Overrides the default settings for this call, e.g, timeout,
retries, etc.

returns.description:

operations such as per-page iteration or access to the response
